com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.container
Class ByteArraySimpleBuilder

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.container.ByteArraySimpleBuilder

@FullyTested
public class ByteArraySimpleBuilder
extends Object

Very simple class to build a byte array: byte[]. Use this class when reading bytes from an InputStream.

This class is intentionally very, very basic. In the future, it may grow if necessary.

As of now, methods Object.equals(Object) and Object.hashCode() are not implemented in this class. These methods use the default implementation from Object.

Author:
Kevin Connor ARPE (kevinarpe@gmail.com)
See Also:
InputStream

Constructor Detail

ByteArraySimpleBuilder

public ByteArraySimpleBuilder(int initialCapacity)
Constructs a new builder. The capacity will be automatically increased later as necessary.

Parameters:
initialCapacity -
  • initial number of bytes of capacity, e.g., 8196 (2^13)
  • must be positive (smallest allowed is one)
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if initialCapacity is not positive
See Also:
length(), append(byte[], int, int), toArray()
Method Detail

length

public int length()
This value is always less than or equal to capacity.

Returns:
number of bytes appended to this builder

append

public ByteArraySimpleBuilder append(byte oneByte)
Appends a single byte to this builder.

Parameters:
oneByte - data to append
Returns:
reference to this
See Also:
append(byte[]), append(byte[], int, int)

append

public ByteArraySimpleBuilder append(byte[] byteArr)
This is a convenience method to call append(byte[], int, int) where params offset is zero and length is byteArr.length.

This method allows parameter byteArr to be empty.

append

public ByteArraySimpleBuilder append(byte[] byteArr,
                                     int offset,
                                     int length)
Appends a segment of an array of bytes to this builder.

Parameters:
byteArr - data to append. Must not be empty, e.g., new byte[0]
offset -
  • Index offset to append bytes from parameter byteArr
  • Valid range: Zero to byteArr.length - 1
length -
  • Number of bytes to append from parameter byteArr
  • Valid range: Zero to byteArr.length - offset
Returns:
reference to this
Throws:
NullPointerException - if byteArr is null
IllegalArgumentException -
  • if byteArr is empty
  • if offset < 0
  • if length < 0
IndexOutOfBoundsException -
  • if offset >= byteArr.length
  • if offset + length > byteArr.length
See Also:
append(byte), append(byte[], int, int)

ensureCapacity

protected void ensureCapacity(int newCapacity)
Ensures the internal byte array has sufficient capacity for additional data to be appended. The growth algorithm is very basic: It doubles the current capacity continuously, until it exceeds newCapacity.

Parameters:
newCapacity - Minimum number of bytes required for internal storage buffer

toArray

public byte[] toArray()
Copies the internal buffer to a new array of data. Only the used area of the buffer is copied to the new array.

Returns:
array of appended data
